input:

42:04 Event: Corner by Crystal Palace
42:18 Caption: Dwight Gayle (Crystal Palace) launches a cross from the corner, but David Ospina is alert to thwart the effort.
42:36 Event: Ball out of play

44:23 Event: Ball out of play
44:32 Caption: Julian Speroni displays his ability to read the game and clears the danger after Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) threatened to latch onto a through ball from just outside the box.
44:51 Event: Clearance by Arsenal
45:08 Event: Goal by Arsenal
45:40 Caption: Great chance! Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
45:55 Caption: Goal! Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) fires the rebound inside the right post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:2.
45:59 Event: Kick-off by Crystal Palace
47:07 Caption: The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
47:59 Caption: Let's hope the players will show us more in the second half as the first one has been rather ordinary, devoid of goalscoring opportunities. There wasn't any evident superiority by either side during the first half. The home side relies mostly on counter-attacks for their chances, while the away team adopts the opposite approach of possession football.

Second Half:

50:10 Caption: Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
50:59 Caption: According to the statistics, the match was pretty entertaining. There were plenty of thrilling moments. Great display from the home side, you have to say that they were the better side today. Long balls and crosses were the main weapons of the home team. The away team tried to find the weakness in the opposition's defence especially with rapid counter-attacks.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
Crystal Palace faced Arsenal in an engaging encounter that showcased an array of tactical plays and spirited individual performances. From the get-go, both teams were eager to make their mark on the game, with Arsenal enjoying an early advantage through a penalty and another goal before half-time, while Crystal Palace remained persistent till they managed a consolatory goal late in the game.

### First Half

The match kicked off with Arsenal in possession. However, it took a mere 19 seconds for the first break in play when the ball went out. Crystal Palace quickly took a throw-in but couldn't make the most of it, leading to another throw-in for Arsenal. The initial minutes of the game were characterized by back-and-forth throw-ins and frequent interruptions, underlining the team’s strive to establish control.

An offside call against Arsenal at the 2:47 mark momentarily halted their advance, and quickly after that, Crystal Palace attempted a strike on goal from their indirect free-kick. Although the effort was off-target, it signaled their intent. At 5:21, Crystal Palace committed a foul, and a mere minute later, another indiscretion provided Arsenal with a golden opportunity through a penalty. Arsenal capitalized on this chance as they netted the ball to gain an early 1-0 lead.

Crystal Palace responded by pressing forward, earning a corner at the ninth minute, though they couldn't convert it into a goal. Nacho Monreal's reckless challenge for Arsenal earned Crystal Palace another free-kick, but the well-organized Arsenal defense promptly neutralized the threat.

The phase of play between the 11th and 15th minutes swung continuously, punctuated by throw-ins and unsuccessful cross attempts, notably from Dwight Gayle and Wilfried Zaha, who notably dribbled past an opponent only for the ball to be cleared. Amidst this, Arsenal focused on their passing game, looking to eke out more openings.

The 18th minute saw Jordon Mutch earn a yellow card for Crystal Palace after a foul, showcasing a somewhat aggressive approach. Arsenal continued their short-passing game, maintaining possession effectively. This approach bore fruit at the 20:34 mark when a corner won by Arsenal culminated in a header by Laurent Koscielny, though off-target.

Another bout of fouls ensued, culminating in Francis Coquelin earning a yellow card in the 27th minute for Arsenal due to a harsh foul. Both teams jostled uncompromisingly, seeking dominance. Crystal Palace's Dwight Gayle attempted a significant low pass towards the goal afterward but was thwarted by the alert Arsenal defense.

At the 31-minute mark, Alexis Sanchez found an opportunity to gather a pass and shoot, though it was blocked swiftly. Crystal Palace wrestled possession and crafted another substantial offensive move when Crystal Palace's Joe Ledley sent a pass into the penalty area, only for it to be intercepted again. Arsenal's passing finesse was evident towards the end of the half, but their moves were constantly checked by Crystal Palace.

As the half neared its conclusion, Crystal Palace threatened again, especially through Dwight Gayle and Wilfried Zaha. The former sent a dangerous shot which was deflected for a corner. Then, another blockade on a Crystal Palace corner ensued.

Just before the half-time whistle, Arsenal demonstrated precision when Danny Welbeck's effort was thwarted, only for Olivier Giroud to capitalize on the rebound, ensuring a 2-0 lead. This brought an end to the first half with Crystal Palace trailing, albeit only marginally outclassed.

### Second Half

Crystal Palace commenced the second half with visible determination upon the restart. Wilfried Zaha exemplified this with an early effort, forcing a corner almost immediately. A string of corners by Crystal Palace ensued in rapid succession, none yielding a goal, but these added pressure on Arsenal.

The aggressive fast-paced nature of the game persisted, with multiple fouls, offsides, and clearances marking the early minutes. Both sides showcased resilient defensive strategy; for instance, Dwight Gayle frequently finding himself stifled by Arsenal defenders.

A notable moment occurred at the 6:54 mark when Mesut Ozil's leaping header crashed against Crystal Palace's crossbar, leaving Arsenal fans on the edge of their seats. Meanwhile, Crystal Palace continued their artillery of corners, notably through Jason Puncheon, whose delivery displayed a constant threat, only occasionally falling short.

Jason Puncheon’s substitution for Yannick Bolasie at the 12:02 mark highlighted Crystal Palace's intent to inject fresh impetus into their offense. Arsenal, however, responded with defensive solidity. Olivier Giroud remained a focal point but once flagged for offside, indicating Crystal Palace's strategic defensive line.

At the 15:40 mark, Arsenal's Olivier Giroud had a golden opportunity from mid-range; his powerful volley demanded an alert response from Julian Speroni, who made an astonishing save. Arsenal maintained their fluid passing, orchestrating longer possessions attempting to erode Crystal Palace's defensive resolve.

Yet, at the 21-minute mark of the second half, Yannick Bolasie exemplified Crystal Palace's relentless attacking pursuit when his shot evoked a mesmerizing save from Arsenal's keeper, maintaining the scoreline intact. Unyielding in their effort, Crystal Palace made another attempt through Dwight Gayle, who replaced Glenn Murray, signaling Alan Pardew's tactical change.

A noteworthy moment saw Glenn Murray drawing an offside call at the 45-minute mark. Subsequent efforts from Crystal Palace didn't materialize until the final moments when Glenn Murray scored a crucial goal after a corner kick. Although there was a fleeting moment of uncertainty regarding alignment with Wilfried Zaha’s earlier shot, it ultimately stood, putting the scoreline at 2-1. This briefly ignited hopes for a spectacular comeback.

However, as the clock wore down, Arsenal showcased their composure and tactical discipline to see off the remainder of the match. The game culminated in 50 minutes of enthralling football, ending in Arsenal's favor with a slender 2-1 victory over Crystal Palace. The win underscored Arsenal’s capacity for seizing critical moments, while Crystal Palace’s valiant efforts, especially in the latter half, reflected their fighting spirit despite falling short.

Both teams exhibited varied tactical approaches: Arsenal’s precise and measured possession play contrasted with Crystal Palace’s high-tempo offense and reliance on set-pieces and long balls. The combination of tactical discipline, key moments of defensive sagaciousness, and offensive opportunism portrayed an engaging and close-fought contest between two competitive Premier League sides.
